result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryce A Branski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances  or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of CBD products or vaping products.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 

No contact with Victim A or Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Restitution for Victim A to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Steven Hughes advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Atty. Hughes response to the State's request for restitution.  Defense have no objection to the requested amount of $599.99.    ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 7/19/22 - Based on no objection by defense Court will amend the JOC to include the $599.99 restitution.**
Motion and Order to Seal Restitution Information signed by Judge Laura Lau July 18, 2022.

Request for Restitution
The original document name was titled: Request for Restitution
The original history event date is: 07-15-2022
Motion and Order to Seal Restitution Info
AMENDED W/DEFENDANT'S SIGNATURE - with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

09:18 AM Defendant Bryce A Branski in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 2.
The State strikes the repeater enhancer in Count 2.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed and read in.

The State presents its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense presents its sentencing recommendation.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS JAIL - STAYED.

- CONSECUTIVE TO 22CM193 & 22CM1052

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR;
-- PROBATION IS CONCURRENT TO ALL CASES.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of CBD products or vaping products;
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  Victim A OR Witness A;
*DNA sample to be provided;

RESTITUTION: TBD.
COURT COSTS:  WAIVED
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
   - to be paid as a condition of probation

The Court gives the State 30 days to file any restitution requests and if contested will set for hearing.

Proposed Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Panel filed by the State.
Filed by the State on behalf of Victim A.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:58 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court.   Defendant Bryce A Branski did not appear.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hughes advises that he was just told the defendant is currently at Winnebago but advises the matters are ready to be resolved.  Atty. Hughes is not sure when the defendant will be back in the jail but is asking the matters be set for plea and sentencing.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing in about 45-60 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:39 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Bryce A Branski in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Steven Hughes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hughes advises that he was just advised of the defendant's new case and would like more time to review everything, he is asking for a further proceedingsd date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for futher proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
